intro: Poecilandra retusa var. retusa, commonly known as the smooth poecilandra, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often smooth and glossy. The plant produces small, white to pale green flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
